maml:description.maml:para: Enable scheduled "Easit task" in Windows Task Scheduler
The Enable-EasitScheduledTask cmdlet enables one or more scheduled "Easit tasks" in Windows Task Scheduler.

maml:Description.maml:para: Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.
Specifies the name of a scheduled task.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies the name of a scheduled task.

dev:remarks.maml:para: In this example all Easit tasks will be enabled.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $taskObj = Get-EasitScheduledTask PS C:\> $taskObj | Enable-EasitScheduledTask

dev:remarks.maml:para: In this example all Easit tasks will be enabled.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $taskObj = Get-EasitScheduledTask PS C:\> Enable-EasitScheduledTask -InputObject $taskObj

dev:remarks.maml:para: In this example all Easit tasks will be enabled.
In this example an Easit tasks with the exact name 'Easit EmailRequest' will be enabled. The parameter TaskName do not support wilcards.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $taskObj = Get-EasitScheduledTask -EmailRequest PS C:\> Enable-EasitScheduledTask -TaskName "$($taskObj.TaskName)"

dev:remarks.maml:para: In this example an Easit tasks called 'Easit EmailRequest' will be enabled.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the configuration settings for one or all mailboxes configured for EmailRequest.
The Get-EasitEmailRequestMailbox cmdlet gets all settings for one or all mailboxed configured for EmailRequest. The cmdlet does not return the password for any mailbox for security reasons.
In order to find the correct configuration file for EmailRequest the cmdlet uses recursive search.

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to root directory for EasitManagementFramework.
Name of EasitManagementFramework configuration file to use.
Name of configuration to use in EasitManagementFramework configuration file.
Name of configuration file to find mailboxes in.
Name of mailbox to update setting for. Same as displayName in EmailRequest configuration file.
Name of configuration file to find mailboxes in.
Name of EasitManagementFramework configuration file to use.
Name of configuration to use in EasitManagementFramework configuration file.
Path to root directory for EasitManagementFramework.
Name of mailbox to update setting for. Same as displayName in EmailRequest configuration file.

dev:remarks.maml:para: In this example we will get all mailboxes configured for EmailRequest.
In this example we will get all settings for a mailbox with POP3Test as its displayName.
In this example we will get all settings for a mailbox with POP3Test as its displayName in config.xml in the folder provided in EmailRequestRoot for EMF-configuration Test.
In this example we will get all settings for a mailbox with POP3Test as its displayName in config_test.xml. Use this syntax if you have multiple configurationfiles for EmailRequest.

maml:description.maml:para: The Get-EasitScheduledTask cmdlet gets scheduled tasks from Windows Task Scheduler. You can get all Easit tasks or use the EmailRequest or ImportClient parameter to specify the task.

maml:Description.maml:para: Switch to specify if only to get tasks containing mail in its name.
Switch to specify if only to get tasks containing import in its name.
Switch to specify if only to get tasks containing mail in its name.
Switch to specify if only to get tasks containing import in its name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets all scheduled tasks with the string easit in its name.
This example gets all scheduled tasks with the string easit and mail in its name.
This example gets all scheduled tasks with the string easit , mail and import in its name. This example with provide the same result as running the cmdlet twice, once for each parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: Used to update / change settings for a "mailbox" used by EmailRequest.
With this cmdlet you can update one setting for an "mailbox" in the configuration file for EmailRequest.

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to root directory for EasitManagementFramework.
Name of EasitManagementFramework configuration file to use.
Name of configuration to use in EasitManagementFramework configuration file.
Name of configuration file for EmailReques to update.
Name of mailbox to update setting for. Same as displayName in EmailRequest configuration file.
Name of parameter to update in EmailRequest configuration file.
New value you would like to give to a parameter in EmailRequest configuration file.
Name of configuration file for EmailReques to update.
Name of EasitManagementFramework configuration file to use.
Name of configuration to use in EasitManagementFramework configuration file.
Path to root directory for EasitManagementFramework.
Name of mailbox to update setting for. Same as displayName in EmailRequest configuration file.
Name of parameter to update in EmailRequest configuration file.
New value you would like to give to a parameter in EmailRequest configuration file.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows you how to enables a mailbox with the displayName POP3Test .
In this example the setting maxMessageSize for POP3Test is set to 12582912 . The value for maxMessageSize should be provided in bytes in the case of POP3 and kilobytes in the case of IMAP4.
In this example the setting maxMessagesToRetrieve for POP3Test is set to 20 . This allows you to set how many unread mail EmailRequest should try to import from the mailbox.
